articles.author: Dartmouth College
articles.title: Changes in diet drove physical evolution in early humans - Phys.org
articles.description: As early humans spread from lush African forests into grasslands, their need for ready sources of energy led them to develop a taste for grassy plants, especially grains and the starchy plant tissue hidden underground.
